sections.heading: ANYTHING YOU SAY OR SIGN CAN BE USED AGAINST YOU.
paragraphs: Whether it’s a reply to a notice, a statement at a police station, or a document someone wants you to sign — your safest move is to understand its legal impact first.
— A single line, a single signature, or even a quick emotional reaction can completely change your position in a case.
— Speaking without clarity can weaken your defence. Signing without reading can bind you to terms you never intended.
— Reacting emotionally can create problems that are difficult to undo.

sections.heading: YOUR FIRST SAFE STEP
bullets: Don’t react, don’t explain, and don’t sign anything yet.
Keep everything with you and talk to someone who understands the law before you say a single word.
This one pause can protect you more than you think.

faqs.question: I just received a notice or complaint. What should I do first?
faqs.answer: Don’t reply immediately. Share it with a legal professional first so you don’t make a mistake that can be used against you.

faqs.question: Do I really need a lawyer right now?
faqs.answer: Maybe, maybe not. It depends on your situation — a quick conversation can tell you exactly what you need.

faqs.question: Can I talk to the other party directly and sort it out?
faqs.answer: Not before understanding the legal risk. Even one wrong message or call can weaken your position.

faqs.question: What if I don’t understand the legal terms in my documents?
faqs.answer: That’s normal. We’ll break everything down for you in simple language so you know what’s actually happening.
